channel.title: [Class Suggestion] Dragon Keeper (Neutral Killing, Dragons without a Dragon class.)
channel.description:
**Dragon Keeper**
Portrait: Bootleg Daenerys. :) Maybe a red-haired, fiery warrior woman with a young dragon on her shoulder? Gotta have them crazy eyes.
Since there are questions about how a "Dragon" class could work - what about a "Mother of Dragons" who uses their pets as weapons to attain power?
Passive 1: **Royal Blood** - As a Royal, you can put your name forward for nominations to become the next King. (Should this class become Neutral or Psycho King?)
Passive 2: [GIANT DRAGON FANGS ICON] **Lizard Food** - Every two players you kill will give you one additional use of your “Iron Drake” day ability. Gotta keep your pets fed for them to perform!
Day Ability: [IRON WINGS ICON] **Iron Drake** - You will be immune from death the following night, also curing Bleeding/Poison. (2 uses, recharged with “Lizard Food” passive.)
Night Ability 1: [FIREBALL ICON] **Flame Drake** - Choose a player to kill. Visitors to your target are Wisped to you. [You see the visitors to target.] (Unlimited uses.)
Night Ability 2: [FROST CLOUD ICON] **Frost Drake** - Choose a player to kill. Other players will be prevented from visiting your target. [Prevents saving/watching target, etc.] (2 uses.)
Lore: As the fairy tale goes, a valiant prince must save a princess from the dragon. No one saved this princess, so she befriended her captors and became a trusted caregiver to the offspring of its kind. Now, she has returned to make the kingdom remember her name.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Dragon Keeper (Neutral Killing, Dragons without a Dragon class.)
item.dc:creator: Ashe
item.description:
Neutral Killers without permanent death immunity tend to be fairly weak, but the additional of Flame/Frost drake effects as well as Lizard Food do somewhat offset the balance. However, since Frost Drake is already limited uses, I would make it either occupy the target as well, or prevent visits to the target rather than occupying visitors, just to make it a little bit more powerful.
